('Jinx', '烏鴉嘴'): He's a Jinx whenever we try to win games.
每次我們想贏遊戲，他就是個烏鴉嘴。
Calling it perfect will make you a Jinx, honestly.
說它完美真的會讓你變成烏鴉嘴，老實說。
('Out of pocket', '自費'): I'll pay out of pocket for the repairs.
我會自費支付這次維修費。
They had to go out of pocket for medication.
I went out of pocket covering the extra costs.
我自費支付了額外費用。
('Choke up', '哽咽'): Don't choke up, just tell them how you feel.
別哽咽，直接告訴他們你的感受。
She'll choke up at her father's speech tonight.
她今晚在爸爸的演講時會哽咽。
('Hold a seat', '佔位子'): I'll hold a seat while you get food.
你去拿食物時，我會幫你佔位子。
Someone needs to hold a seat near the stage.
有人需要在舞台附近佔位子。
('Keep an eye on', '顧個東西的「顧」'): I'll keep an eye on the kids today.
Keep an eye on the soup while I cook.
我煮飯時你幫我顧一下湯，好嗎？
(\"Hit one's funny bone\", '戳中笑點'): His silly dance always hits my funny bone instantly.
他那個搞笑的舞蹈總是立刻戳中我的笑點。
That pun hit her funny bone and she snorted.
那個雙關語戳中她的笑點，她還噴了一聲。
('Give someone the eye', '拋媚眼'): Don't give her the eye if you're taken.
如果你已經有伴，不要對她拋媚眼。
He keeps giving his coworker the eye daily.
他每天都對同事拋媚眼。
('flab', '贅肉'): She pinched the flab on her waist jokingly.
她開玩笑地捏了捏腰間的贅肉。
Daily cardio helped shrink the annoying arm flab.
每天的有氧運動幫我縮小惱人的手臂贅肉。
('kept man', '小白臉'): Nobody respects him because he's a kept man.
沒有人尊重他，因為他是個小白臉。
She prefers a kept man over a struggling partner.
她寧願要個小白臉，也不要辛苦打拼的伴侶。
('jump the gun', '操之過急'): We might jump the gun if we decide now.
如果我們現在就決定，可能會操之過急。
Don't jump the gun and sign anything yet.
別操之過急，還不要簽任何東西。
She jumped the gun, starting the meeting without me.
她操之過急，沒等我就開始開會。
Don't jump the gun — wait for confirmation first.
別操之過急，先等確認再說。
('slowpoke', '慢郎中'): He's a slowpoke when it comes to homework.
他做功課時真是個慢郎中。
Don't be such a slowpoke, hurry up now.
別當慢郎中了，快點走吧。
That slowpoke missed the bus again this morning.
那個慢郎中今天早上又錯過公車了。
Stop acting like a slowpoke and move it.
別再裝成慢郎中，快點動起來。
('vicious cycle', '惡性循環'): Low morale led to mistakes, fueling a vicious cycle.
士氣低落導致錯誤，進而加劇惡性循環。
We must break the vicious cycle before it worsens.
我們必須在惡化前打破這個惡性循環。
('fair-weather friend', '酒肉朋友'): If trouble comes, my fair-weather friends disappear quickly.
有麻煩時，我的酒肉朋友很快就消失了。
Don't trust him; he's a fair-weather friend.
別信他；他只是個酒肉朋友。
A fair-weather friend disappears when things get tough.
遇到困難時，酒肉朋友就會消失。
I dumped my fair-weather friend after they lied.
他們說謊後，我就跟那個酒肉朋友斷交了。
('s', '慢郎中'): If you're an s, you'll miss the meeting.
如果你當慢郎中，你會錯過會議。
I hate waiting when someone is such an s.
我討厭等人，尤其是那個慢郎中。
('烏鴉嘴',): You're such a jinx, cut it out.
你真是個烏鴉嘴，別再這樣了。
Saying that might jinx our whole plan.
這麼說可能會讓我們整個計畫破功。
(\"I'll give you that.\",): Fine, I'll give you that—your story makes sense.
好吧，我承認——你的故事有道理。
Okay, I'll give you that, you warned me earlier.
好，我承認，你早就警告過我。
(\"That's a given\",): With her resume, that's a given during hiring.
憑她的履歷，錄取時那是理所當然的。
If she volunteers, I'll help. That's a given.
如果她自願，我會幫忙。那是理所當然的。
With his experience, that's a given in interviews.
以他的經驗，面試時那是理所當然的。
You think he'll quit? That's a given, honestly.
你覺得他會辭職？老實說，那是理所當然的。
('Learn the ropes',): It took me weeks to learn the ropes here.
我花了好幾週才熟悉這裡的工作。
New hires must learn the ropes before Friday.
新進員工必須在週五前熟悉工作流程。
(\"twist one's arm\",): She won't buy it unless you twist her arm.
除非你逼她，否則她不會同意。
Don't twist my arm; I'll help willingly.
('Savage',): He's a savage on the football field, no mercy.
他在足球場上很兇猛，毫不留情。
Don't be savage; apologize for what you said.
別那麼野蠻；為你說的話道歉。
(\"Don't put yourself out\",): If it's too much, don't put yourself out.
如果太吃力，就別太勉強自己。
Don't put yourself out just to please others.
別為了討好別人而委屈自己。
('Sassy',): Don't be so sassy with your teacher, okay?
別對老師那麼放肆，好嗎？
I love her sassy style and bold attitude.
我喜歡她俏皮的風格和大膽的態度。
('I have a thing for you',): Between us, I have a thing for you.
我們之間，我對你有感覺。
Honestly, I have a thing for you, can't deny.
老實說，我對你有意思，無法否認。
I have a thing for you, and it's serious.
我對你有感覺，而且是認真的。
I have a thing for you; hope that's okay.
我對你有意思，希望你不介意。
('Make a scene',): He threatened to make a scene over the bill.
他威脅要為了那張帳單大吵大鬧。
If you call her, she'll probably make a scene.
如果你打給她，她很可能會大吵大鬧。
('Hand to god',): Hand to god, I'm telling the truth this time.
我向上帝發誓，這次我說的是真的。
Hand to god, he'll be here before the movie starts.
我向上帝發誓，他會在電影開始前到這裡。
('take it in stride',): When plans changed, he simply took it in stride.
計畫改變時，他只是從容應對。
You'll face setbacks; just take it in stride.
你會遇到挫折；只要處之泰然就好。
(\"pull one's leg\",): I thought she was serious, but she pulled my leg.
我以為她是認真的，但她只是在逗我玩。
Stop pulling his leg about the job offer, please.
別再拿那份工作逗他了，拜託。
('Beats me',): Beats me how they managed to finish early.
我搞不懂他們怎麼能提早完成。
Honestly, beats me what she meant by that.
老實說，我真不知道她那句話是什麼意思。
('have someone going',): Don't try to have me going like that again.
Her prank had everyone going for a while there.
她的惡作劇一度讓大家都信以為真。
(\"You're way off\",): Honestly, you're way off with that assumption.
說實話，你那個假設完全錯了。
You're way off if you think it's simple.
如果你認為這很簡單，那你就大錯特錯。
('rainmaker', '搖錢樹'): We need a rainmaker to boost sales this year.
我們需要一位搖錢樹，來提升今年的銷售。
His network makes him the team's top rainmaker.
他的人脈讓他成為團隊的頭號搖錢樹。
('power trip', '耍官威'): Stop letting him go on a power trip at work.
別再讓他在公司耍官威了。
Don't let your boss go on a power trip.
('PDA (public display of affection)', '放: Stop the PDA, some people are trying to eat.
別放閃了，有人在努力吃飯。
Her constant PDA made everyone roll their eyes.
她一直放閃，讓大家翻白眼。
('talk back', '頂嘴'): If she talks back, she'll get grounded this weekend.
如果她頂嘴，就會在這個週末被禁足。
Why do kids always talk back these days?
現在的小孩為什麼老是頂嘴？
('give a hickey', '種草莓'): She tried to give a hickey but failed.
她試圖種草莓但沒成功。
I saw them give a hickey under the table.
我看到他們在桌下種草莓。
